grading_system.description: Information about specific grading system not found on official website. County follows California Retail Food Code but specific grading methodology not publicly documented.

inspection_details.frequency: Not specified on county website - likely risk-based per California standards
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Critical violations must be corrected at time of inspection and may require follow-up inspection; re-inspection not usually required for minor violations only
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports available online at county website; official records maintained by Environmental Health Department

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Multiple fire departments - 33 Fire Departments serve Lassen County
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen hood fire suppression systems require semi-annual inspections per NFPA 96 standards; Class K fire extinguishers required within 30 feet of grease cooking operations
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every 6 months for commercial kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - California Health and Safety Code, effective July 1, 2007
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level enforcement - Lassen County Environmental Health Department conducts inspections of permanent, mobile and temporary food facilities
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Not specified beyond state CalCode requirements
permit_types: Health Permit to Operate Food Facility
Food Handler Cards likely required per state law

confidence_notes: Limited specific information available on Lassen County's official website regarding grading methodology, inspection frequency schedules, and detailed operational procedures. Fire safety information based on general California/NFPA standards.
verification_notes: Direct contact with Lassen County Environmental Health Department needed to verify: 1) Specific grading system used (letter grades, numerical scores, or pass/fail), 2) Inspection frequency schedules and risk categorization, 3) Local ordinances beyond state requirements, 4) Specific fire department authority for commercial kitchens, 5) Fee schedules and permit requirements. Contact: ehe@co.lassen.ca.us or (530) 251-8373.
